title: Next 6 months critical for SL to leverage geopolitical shifts: Tax expert
byline: As Sri Lanka stands at a critical juncture in its economic development, after facing what was the worst crisis in history, the first half of 2025 (1H25) would be a critical period for the island nation, a tax expert said.

title: China pledges deeper ties with Sri Lanka
byline: China yesterday pledged support to Sri Lanka, with President Xi Jinping expressing readiness to collaborate with the island nation towards a new era of development.

title: Rs. 260 million pilot boat sparks concern after private excursion accident
byline: Officials involved in a modern, high-tech pilot boat worth around Rs. 260 million have become concerned after a complaint was filed regarding the loss incurred after it was involved in an accident during a private excursion, the ‘Magen Ratata’ organisation chairman Sanjaya Mahawatte said.

title: Will continue govt. business despite SJB’s decision to boycott Parliamentary Committees: Lal Kantha
byline: The government will continue its businesses despite the decision by the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) to boycott Parliamentary Committee meetings, Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Land and Irrigation Lal Kantha said.

title: 15 MoUs signed between Sri Lanka, China: Vijitha
byline: Sri Lanka and China signed fifteen Memorandums of Understanding (MoU) following bi-lateral talks bewteen the two countries, Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath said today.

title: Rear Admiral Chinthaka Kumarasinghe appointed as SL Navy’s Deputy Chief of Staff
byline: Rear Admiral Chinthaka Kumarasinghe was appointed as the Deputy Chief of Staff of the Sri Lanka Navy effective from 31 December 2024.
